summary:
Here is a summarized version of the Security Council document:

The Security Council:
Reaffirms its previous resolutions on Afghanistan, particularly resolution 1383 (2001), and its commitment to the sovereignty, independence, territorial integrity, and national unity of Afghanistan.

Welcomes the successful holding of the Emergency Loya Jirga (11-19 June), which had large participation of women and representation of all ethnic and religious communities.

Commends the Afghan people for the success of the Emergency Loya Jirga and encourages them to determine their own political future.

Welcomes the election of President Hamid Karzai and the establishment of the Transitional Authority.

Supports the Transitional Authority in implementing the Bonn Agreement, strengthening the central government, building a national army and police force, and improving security.

Calls on all Afghan groups to cooperate with the Transitional Authority to complete the process according to the Bonn Agreement.

Urges the Transitional Authority to eradicate the poppy crop, promote the welfare of Afghan women and children, and provide education to boys and girls.

Commends the role of the United Nations system, particularly the Special Representative of the Secretary-General, Mr. Lakhdar Brahimi, and the United Nations Assistance Mission in Afghanistan (UNAMA).

Commends the contribution of the International Security Assistance Force (ISAF) in providing a secure environment for the Emergency Loya Jirga.

Stresses the importance of continued international support, calls on donor countries to fulfil their financial commitments, and urges Member States to provide long-term assistance.

Calls for significantly greater international assistance to Afghan refugees and internally displaced persons.

Calls on all Afghan groups to support full and unimpeded access by humanitarian organizations.

Decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
